quest.name: A Fickle Existence
journal: Alphinaud wears a look of profound disapproval.
objectives: Search for the Mystel at the designated area.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You disapprove of these people's way of life?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You disapprove of Eulmore?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Disapprove...? It frustrates me, certainly. That is only part of it, though. The whole situation makes me uneasy.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: 'Tis difficult to make a final judgment without first seeing the city's inner workings. Mayhap it is that uncertainty which always makes me feel so ill at ease here...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Not that it matters. However unjust this system seems to me, if these people claim to be content with their lot, it is hardly my place to criticize their choices.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But take that elderly lady you rescued─does it not seem that those who have chosen to forgo Eulmore's largesse are doomed to suffer for their independence?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: In the end, they are all but forced to seek refuge in Gatetown. And so hamlets and fields across the island are left empty and untended, hastening the region's descent into ruin.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Nay, I am not convinced that Eulmore's generosity truly serves the best interests of Kholusia's people.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I am not so naive as to think there is some miraculous solution to all of this. Yet I cannot help but frown at the sight of hardworking villagers struggling to survive, even as the chosen few rejoice at being plucked from poverty by the hand of a capricious noble.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: There has to be a better way. I will not know for sure, however, until I have taken those long-delayed steps through Eulmore's gates.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: 'Tis fortunate that you arrived when you did, Forename. I have been working on a scheme to insinuate myself into the city, and if all goes to plan, it should soon come to fruition.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: There is a beast tribe who makes its home in the seas surrounding the island. The Ondo, they are called, though you and I know them as Sahagin.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: For the most part, they keep to themselves in their ocean grottoes, and rarely have dealings with land-dwellers.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But as Tataru took such great pains to impress upon me during our stay in Kugane, business favors the bold. And so I reached out to them.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I duly discovered that the Ondo are inordinately fond of land-grown produce─fresh fruits in particular. And when I offered to procure such goods for them, they promised to pay me in pearls.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: An attractive business venture for any prospective investor, would you not agree? Surely even the most jaded Eulmoran lord would have time for a merchant who can make pearls from plums and pumpkins?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Yes, I've come a long way since my days of buying samurai swords without first negotiating a price!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: My appointment with the Ondo is due to take place in a few hours. I just need to collect the produce and meet with them on the shore.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Might you help me make the exchange?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Excellent, I should be glad of your company.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: First things first, then─we must pay a visit to Mosha-Moa, my supplier in Wright. Come, it is just to the northwest of here.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: This is Mosha-Moa, the farmer of whom I spoke.

dialogue.name: MOSHAMOA
dialogue.text: ...Is there something I can do for you, friend?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Good day to you, Mosha-Moa. This is my associate, Forename. We are here to collect the produce I purchased.

dialogue.name: MOSHAMOA
dialogue.text: ...Eh? I loaded your lackey up with the goods not long ago.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: My lackey? I know of no such person!

dialogue.name: MOSHAMOA
dialogue.text: Mystel lad, short blue hair? ...No? He said he'd come on your behalf, and since he seemed to know all the details, I just assumed...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Confound it. Someone must have been eavesdropping on our conversation...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If this charlatan was here not long ago, he cannot have gone far. We should split up and search the area. You find a vantage point on the south side of town, and I shall take the west!

dialogue.name: MOSHAMOA
dialogue.text: Forgive me, I had no cause to doubt the lad. Still, he shouldn't be hard to spot with that blue hair of his...

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Search the surroundings for a male Mystel with short blue hair. You may move the camera as well as zoom in and out. Target a likely suspect and inspect him with [???] / [???].

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Forename! Any sign of him!?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...You've a keen eye. Let us move in, before he makes good his escape!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Here! He's breathing, I think, though he won't last long without help.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...That should take care of the worst of his injuries.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: <cough> <splutter> Mercy... Mercy, I beg you...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Breathe easy, sir. No harm will come to you here.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The poor man is shivering. Pray keep an eye on him while I get a fire going.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: I thought for certain I was d-dead. How am I ever to repay this kindness...?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We'll settle for the tale behind your current predicament. Why don't you begin by telling us your name?

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: (-Tristol-)Tristol. I was invited into Eulmore to work as an artist...

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: (-Tristol-)A wealthy couple took me in to paint pictures for them, but when my style proved contrary to their taste, they just as quickly turfed me out onto the street.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: (-Tristol-)I was left penniless and patronless─a grave sin in Lord Vauthry's city.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: (-Tristol-)Within days, they had brought me before the man himself, and he asked me what I meant to do. Dejected as I was, I told him that I wished to leave...

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: (-Tristol-)Little did I know how soon he would grant me my wish! They flung me over the balustrade into the godsdamned ocean!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: From up there!? How were you not dashed to pieces!?

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: (-Tristol-)Don't ask me. Luck, I suppose. Though if you hadn't found me when you did, it wouldn't have counted for much.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Monstrous... And the citizens condone such barbaric punishment!?

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: (-Tristol-)Oh, without a second thought. When Lord Vauthry passes judgment, no one so much as blinks, let alone argues.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: (-Tristol-)In Eulmore, his word is law.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: Ah, that fire's chased the chill from my bones. Thank you again...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The more I hear about Eulmore, the more determined I am to see what waits within its walls.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I shall bend all my thoughts toward securing another way into the city. There must be something we can do...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But first, we should convey Tristol to the shelter of the village. Fire or no fire, he needs to be out of this chilly coastal air.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: A way into the city...?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I wonder what Tristol will do now...

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: Pray accept my deepest gratitude. I owe you both my life.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: And...if you'll permit me, I would assist you in your attempt to enter Eulmore─insofar as I am able, at any rate.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: To be frank, the thought of sending my saviors into that awful place makes me sick to the stomach─but since it's plain you've set your minds on it...you should take this.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: It's my favorite paintbrush.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: The Eulmoran elite are never satisfied until they get exactly what they want, and if I'm not mistaken, the couple I mentioned will be looking for someone to replace me. If you make a show of owning such a well-used brush, you may be able to convince people you have a talent for painting.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Are you certain? This is your livelihood. We cannot deprive you of such a treasured possession...

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: I give it gladly after all you've done for me. Besides, I can't─ I...don't think I have the heart to paint anymore.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: As to what I'll do instead...I honestly haven't decided. But I shan't stay long in this place─not with that city brooding over me. Nay, I'll move on to new lands and a new profession. And I'll keep you in my prayers from now until my dying day.
